p: 3) Although the viral suppression rates are similar to those of other men, the rate of viral suppression in men in South Africa is well below that of women. e.g. 2017 South African national HIV prevalence, incidence, behaviour and communication survey: viral suppression in men- 43%; viral suppression in women- 58%. Is it possible that the finding of similar viral suppression in MSM/TG is related to the fact that men in general experience such significant access barriers?
